item.title: EU backs Bangladesh's democratic transition efforts
item.description: The European Union (EU) has expressed support for Bangladesh's ongoing transition under the interim government, reaffirming its confidence in the country's leadership and encouraging political parties to participate constructively in the electoral process, reports BSS. In a Facebook post, the EU s

item.title: EC to hold talks with 12 parties, including Jamaat, on Monday ahead of general election
item.description: The Election Commission is going to hold talks with 12 political parties, including the Jamaat-e-Islami, on Monday for its third day of dialogue with political stakeholders ahead of the parliamentary elections. On Saturday, EC’s Public Relations Assistant Director, Md Ashadul Haque said the

item.title: The lost magic of watching TV shows together
item.description: Television first arrived in Bangladesh in the 1960s; it was a wonder to the Bangalees. In those early days, owning a television was a privilege. My grandparents have told us that when someone in the neighbourhood had a TV set, people from nearby houses would gather to watch whatever was being bro

item.title: RAB CO tells how Jarez orchestrated trader Ashraful’s murder
item.description: Rangpur trader Ashraful Haque was allegedly lured to his death by his friend Jarez, who then killed and dismembered him in a planned manner, said Lt Col Fayezul Arefin, commanding officer of RAB-3. "The brutal killing was the result of a calculated plot carried out under the guise of friendship,"

item.title: Bangladesh introduces new police uniform in phased distribution
item.description: Bangladesh Police have begun distributing new uniforms, initially to a limited number of personnel, according to bdnews24.com. Dhaka Metropolitan Police spokesperson Talebur Rahman said the uniform rollout began on Saturday and will be distributed to all members in phases. Metropolitan police m

item.title: The city we're forgetting: Dhaka's vanishing heritage
item.description: Dhaka is changing faster than it can remember itself. The city's skyline now tells two very different stories. One is written in the fading terracotta of old buildings and the shade of age-old trees. The other is spelt out in the reflective glass of new towers that define its growing ambition. Th

item.title: Restoration work of 44 ponds, waterbodies begin in Dhaka
item.description: The government on Saturday launched restoration work on 44 ponds(khas) and waterbodies in Dhaka and its outskirts, aiming to rebuild and preserve key waterbodies, protect natural drainage system and strengthen environmental balance. Environment Adviser Syeda Rizwana Hasan inaugurated the climate r

item.title: A new Bangladesh is aspiration of July Uprising: Rizvi
item.description: BNP Senior Joint Secretary General Ruhul Kabir Rizvi today (Saturday) said that the aspiration of the July Uprising is a new Bangladesh. He said, "The self-sacrifice and aspiration of the martyrs in the July Uprising is a new Bangladesh. A new Bangladesh where no fascist will ever be born again, w

item.title: Indonesia landslide kills 6 in Central Java, 17 missing, state media says
item.description: A landslide in Indonesia's Central Java killed six people with 17 missing, state news agency Antara reported on Saturday, after prolonged, heavy rains. The landslide on Thursday in the city of Cilacap buried a dozen houses in Cibeunying village, Antara said, citing disaster official Budi Irawan.

item.title: ISU hosts seminar to enhance textile students’ professional skills
item.description: A seminar titled “Essential Skills for a Successful Textile Engineer” was organized by the ISU Textile Club of International Standard University (ISU) on Thursday afternoon at the university’s Mohakhali campus. The event aimed to enhance students’ professional competencies

item.title: Hero Alam arrested on charges of attempting to murder his former wife
item.description: Police have arrested popular content creator Hero Alam at his office in Ulon, Hatirjheel, in connection with an attempt to murder case filed by his former wife Ria Monir. On Saturday, Dhaka Metropolitan Police Tejgaon Deputy Commissioner Ibne Mizan said Alom was sent to court under the warrant, re

item.title: Employers prioritising problem-solving skills over academic achievement: Dr Fouzul Kabir
item.description: Securing employment based solely on academic results has become increasingly difficult, as employers now prioritise problem-solving abilities, said Dr Muhammad Fouzul Kabir Khan, Adviser to the Interim Government for the Ministries of Road Transport and Bridges, Railways, and Power, Energy and Mine
